```{r data generation, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
options(scipen=999)
## 1/A * (x-h)^2 - B = 0
gcd2 <- function(a, b) {
    if (b == 0) a else Recall(b, a %% b)
}
gcd <- function(...) Reduce(gcd2, c(...))

pn = function(c,d){
    p = paste0("{",c,"}x^{",d,"}",collapse="+")
    p = gsub("x^{0}","",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("x^{1}","x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("+{-","-{",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("+{1}x","+x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("-{1}x","-x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("{-1}x","-x",p,fixed=T)
    p = gsub("{1}x","x",p,fixed=T)
    return(p)
}

while(T){
    A = sample(2:15,1)
    B = sample(1:30,1)
    h = sample(1:9,1)*sample(c(-1,1),1)
    if(sqrt(A*B)%%1==0 && A!=B){break}
}

a1 = -sqrt(A*B)+h
a2 = sqrt(A*B)+h
ia1 = -sqrt(A*B)-h
ia2 = sqrt(A*B)-h

dlt = sample(c(3,-2,-1,1,2,3),2)

ia3 = -sqrt(A*B)+h+dlt
ia4 = sqrt(A*B)+h+dlt
ia5 = -sqrt(A*B)-h+dlt
ia6 = sqrt(A*B)-h+dlt

ach = sort(unique(c(a1,a2,ia1,ia2,ia3,ia4,ia5,ia6)))
al = paste0("* $x=",ach,"$",collapse="\n")

sol1 = 1*(ach==a1)
sol2 = 1*(ach==a2)
sol = paste0(1*((sol1+sol2)!=0),collapse="")

if(h<0){
    wrd = paste0("Subtract ",-h," from both sides.")
} else {
    wrd = paste0("Add ",h," to both sides.")
}

```

Question
========

Solve the following equation:

$$\frac{1}{`r A`}(`r pn(c(1,-h),c(1,0))`)^2-`r B`=0$$


Answerlist
--------

`r al`



Solution
========

Add `r B` to both sides of the equation.


$$\frac{1}{`r A`}(`r pn(c(1,-h),c(1,0))`)^2~=~`r B`$$

Multiply both sides of the equation by `r A`.


$$(`r pn(c(1,-h),c(1,0))`)^2~=~`r A*B`$$

We wish to undo the squaring. Remember, since $y=x^2$ is not a one-to-one function, we need to consider multiple possibilities. In this case, we need to consider both the positive and negative square roots.

In other words... square-root both sides, and remember the $\pm$. If necessary, use a calculator to find $\sqrt{`r A*B`}=`r sqrt(A*B)`$.


$$`r pn(c(1,-h),c(1,0))`~=~\pm`r round(sqrt(A*B))`$$

`r wrd`


$$x~=~ `r h` \pm`r round(sqrt(A*B))`$$

We can consider these two possibilities separately.

$$\begin{align*}
x&=`r h`-`r sqrt(A*B)` &\text{or} && x&=`r h`+`r sqrt(A*B)`\\
x&=`r h-sqrt(A*B)` &\text{or} && x&=`r h+sqrt(A*B)`\\
\end{align*}$$
